text: is a United States Air Force base in Japan.Baldwin, Hanson W. "Japan Is Seeking Major U.S. Facilities on Okinawa," New York Times. December 22, 1970; retrieved 2012-1-24. The military base is in the towns of Kadena and Chatan and the city of Okinawa in Okinawa Prefecture. ==History== During the invasion of Okinawa in 1945, the airport was bombed by the US. The damage was repaired and it became a US air base.Nakieru, Omoviekovwa A. (2004). The Fighter Pilot Who Refused to Die: The Authorized Biography of Lt. Col. (Ret) Richard Suehr. p. 148. The American air base on this Japanese island is controversial. == Related pages == * List of airports in Japan == References == == Other websites == * Kadena Air Base Category:Airports in Japan Category:Okinawa Prefecture
title: Kadena Air Base
